intro: Schizolaena parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered schizolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Schizolaena parviflora is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
